result.execSummary:
The defendant David Wilson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess Firearm on Grounds of a School, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.605(2)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Court ordered defendant to pay a $500.00 fine, plus DNA surcharge, costs and disbursements within 30 days of today's date (by 7/16/14). Failure to pay amounts in full would result in a civil judgment entered against defendant which is non-dischargable in bankruptcy.
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon not to possess any firearms. Court further advised defendant of voting ineligibility.

charges.descr: Possess Firearm on Grounds of a School

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. David Wilson

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant David Wilson in court with attorney Daniel G Mitchell.  Deann L Heard appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Plea hearing proceeds.  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, and further advised that if not a United States citizen deportation is possible. Defendant sworn, examined as to plea, and entered a plea of guilty.  Court found defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived all constitutional rights. Plea questionnaire waiver of rights and addendum to plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulated to the criminal complaint as factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered into the record.  The Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon not to possess any firearms. Court further advised defendant of voting ineligibility.    

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  Additional statements by:  Attorney Richard Rakita.  

The Court ordered defendant to pay a $500.00 fine, plus DNA surcharge, costs and disbursements within 30 days of today's date (by 7/16/14).  Failure to pay amounts in full would result in a civil judgment entered against defendant which is non-dischargable in bankruptcy.


Filed,
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief.

Defendant David Wilson in court with attorney Daniel G Mitchell.  Kimberly D Schoepp appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy court clerk: LMS.  Defense is in trial and request an adjournment.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 16, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant David Wilson in court with attorney Daniel G Mitchell.  Deann L Heard appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense counsel requested a date for plea and sentencing. Court ordered case continued before Branch 20 and all conditions of bail remain.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for May 30, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant David Wilson in court with attorney Daniel Gordon Mitchell.  Kimberly D. Schoepp appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense counsel needs additional time to discuss case with Deputy District Attorney Jeff Altenburg.  Court granted request and ordered all terms and conditions of bail to continue.  Plea hearing scheduled for April 29, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant David Wilson in court with attorney Daniel Gordon Mitchell.  Deann L. Heard appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Moroney, Branch 20.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty.  Scheduling conference scheduled for March 20, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered no possession or use of no dangerous weapons or firearms.
 $1000.00 cash bail to be returned to the poster (remitter).

Defendant David Wilson in court with attorney Daniel Mitchell.  Carole R Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: TC.
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Moroney, Branch 20.
Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT DOES NOT QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION. Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 4, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant is Out-of-Custody. Court appearance in Out-Of-Custody Court, Room 221 Safety Building on 2/21/14 @ 1:30pm
